subject: No joke, we’re looking for speakers!
body:
Speak at Rustici: The Gathering
                                                               
Apply to speak
Rustici: The Gathering
Join us online September 23 - 25, 2025
Learn more and submit to speak →
Hi R,
It might be April Fool’s Day, but this is no joke! We’re so excited to have our fourth annual 
Rustici: The Gathering
 conference this September, and we’re looking for customers who would like to speak! The Gathering is a free, three-day virtual user summit, and we’re preparing for several fun sessions about eLearning standards, how our customers are using Rustici products and more.
We’re currently accepting speaking proposals. We’re looking for your innovative how-tos, best-practices, success stories with our products, lessons learned and solution-focused proposals. We'd love to hear stories on how you’re using Rustici products in interesting ways. This is a great way to show off what you do and share best practices for other customers. Case studies or your customers' stories are great! Or feel free to dive into more technical aspects of your application.
If this is something you or someone at your company would be interested in participating in, please 
fill out our request for speakers
. Want to learn more about Rustici: The Gathering? 
Check out our conference page
 to learn more about Rustici: The Gathering. 
Submission deadline: April 30th.
Thank you for being a great Rustici customer and considering the opportunity! Please don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions.
Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director
Let us know if you plan to join us!
In the following months, we’ll be sending session details and the schedule of events.
Submit your proposal today →

subject: The Link: What’s new in Content Controller, all about LTI, where we’ll be and more
body:
The Link Newsletter
News from 
rusticisoftware.com
, 
scorm.com
, and 
xapi.com
March 2025, Issue 26
Hitting the ground running
We’re three months into 2025, and we’ve already had a run of exciting product announcements. Last month, we launched 
Rustici Generator
, our first AI enabled product. Designed to help our customers take the next step in providing valuable learning experiences, Rustici Generator is a content processor that parses eLearning content to make the most of large training catalogs.
But that’s not all! We also recently released exciting new features our customers have been eagerly awaiting in both 
Content Controller
 and 
Rustici Engine
. While 2025 feels like a sprint so far, we're excited to see where our customers take these new features as we hit the road for the upcoming conference season ahead!
 
Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director
Product news
New self-service web portals in Content Controller 4.1
We’re excited to announce Content Controller 4.1! This release is packed with features designed to streamline your content distribution, like the new Content Portal. Now, you can create custom portals for each client, tailor the portal experience and put the power of choice in your customers’ hands.
Take a look →
eLearning standards
Don’t miss our webinar “Diving into LTI: From the basics to Deep Linking”
As the standards experts, we’ve seen an uptick in questions over the years about LTI. Now, Luke and Ashton are diving into the depths of LTI to bring you information on what it is, who it’s for, the different versions, Deep Linking and more. Don’t miss the upcoming webinar on March 20th!
Register now →
Upcoming events
Spring is here! That means we’re also gearing up for conference season
The Rustici team is ready for warmer weather and to hit the road! We have a packed spring calendar filled with everything from virtual webinars to traveling around the US and overseas to speak and exhibit. Will we see you in-person at a conference or virtually soon?
See where we'll be →
Case study
How Acorn PLMS empowers their customers with Rustici Dispatch
Acorn PLMS saw from customer feedback that their learners didn’t want to log into yet another platform. Acorn found a solution in Rustici Dispatch to bring customer content to the learner's LMS. They were able to go to market in under 3 months and now have thousands of happy learners because of it.
Read their story →

subject: Introducing our newest product, Rustici Generator
body:
See what's inside your training, to help build more effective courses.
                              
Introducing our newest product
We are thrilled to reveal that our new product, 
Rustici Generator
, is now available! At Rustici Software, we’re committed to addressing customer and industry challenges related to eLearning standards and content distribution. With this new product, we're excited to extend our expertise beyond eLearning standards support to helping our customers make the most of their content catalogs.
Here are a few ways that Rustici Generator can help with your content management and curation efforts:
Know what’s inside your catalog and courses with 
content parsing
.
Fill-in-the-blanks
 with metadata generation, skills mapping and question suggestions.
Find what you need, when you need it, with semantic and lexical search​.
Rustici Generator is an integrated, standalone API service and is built to give you the flexibility to adjust its implementation or settings to your particular needs. It’s available as an 
add-on to Rustici Engine
, with plans to incorporate this functionality into our other products, including Content Controller in the near future.
Let’s explore the possibilities​!
Learn how you can start saving time on content management by reaching out to our team today! You can also check out our 
product page
 for technical information and walkthroughs or read Tammy Rutherford’s, Managing Director of Rustici Software, 
announcement to learn more
.
Talk with us

subject: The Link: Is SCORM dead, hear from Mike Rustici, DevLearn fun and more
body:
The Link Newsletter
News from 
rusticisoftware.com
, 
scorm.com
, and 
xapi.com
December 2024, Issue 25
Connections and community
As we near the finish line for 2024, it’s been a whirlwind. We’re still catching our breath from a busy DevLearn conference where we had the chance to connect with many of our customers and the eLearning community as a whole. We also recently wrapped up our 3rd annual customer summit, Rustici: The Gathering, with a focus on adapting and embracing change. From the rapidly evolving technologies we use to where and how we work, we covered a lot of great topics and had some incredible customer stories to share. I especially 
enjoyed chatting with our original founder, Mike Rustici
, on how we've evolved over the years. You don’t want to miss hearing for yourself how grandma says you’re supposed to pronounce “Rustici.” (it’s at 49:50 if you want to skip ahead).
And this week, we are all busy catching up with each other in the office and in person during our annual Thanksmas event, my favorite time of year! All of these chances to connect with people near and far reminds me that we’re part of a larger community and one that we’re very thankful to support.
Wishing all of our customers and friends a happy holidays,
 
Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director
Recent news
Second most wonderful time of year: Catching up with you at DevLearn
We always look forward to DevLearn to chat with our customers in person. We kicked it off with a co-presentation with LOMA about how Content Controller helps them centralize content management and more. We also had the opportunity to interview Acorn PLMS about how their platform uses Rustici Driver behind the scenes.
See the highlights →
eLearning standards
Is SCORM dead? Standards adoption by the SCORM Cloud numbers
With SCORM being 20+ years old, it’s understandable that some might question if it’s still viable. Based on SCORM Cloud data, which sees a lot of course launches every day, here’s what the adoption numbers for SCORM, xAPI and cmi5 have to say.
Check out the blog →
Product news
Preview Rustici Generator, our new content parsing tool with AI flare
Our recent webinar dove deep into our latest product, Rustici Generator. It is an API-driven content parsing service with AI-enabled tools to help you get a step ahead in searching and curating personalized content. Watch the recording to see the features in detail, where they fit in our products and a quick demo of how it works.
Watch the recording →
Case study
SimTutor made authoring standards support easy with Rustici Driver
SimTutor provides simulation-based eLearning content and authoring tools. When their customers started to reach out about needing standards support in the authoring tool, it was a no-brainer. Rustici Driver was a turn-key solution that allowed SimTutor to add an industry necessity quickly and easily.
Read their story →

subject: Webinar reminder: Preview Rustici Generator with us soon!
body:
Join us at our webinar on our AI-enabled product Rustici Generator!
                                                               
Upcoming webinar
You have been looking through your library, trying and trying to find content that fits the learner or goal, but nothing seems to be the right fit! It may start to feel like going through your library can be like navigating a corn maze with no way out. Lucky for you, we have just the tool to give you a kernel of hope.
 
Register now →
Join our webinar to preview Rustici Generator!
Get a sneak peek at our latest add-on product, 
Rustici Generator
. At its core, it is a content parsing tool that allows you to build out metadata, map skills, create basic questions, pull out content text, and so much more. With these great features, you can make it easier for your team to fill in the gaps in your content data, find what you need when you need it. 
Our speakers Reed McLean, Developer of Rustici Generator, and Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director, will guide you through the product in more detail and show how Rustici Generator can help you concentrate on more important tasks!
Sign up today to join us on November 19, 2024 at 10AM CST.

Day 2 of

Day 3 of Rustici: The Gathering starts soon, and these upcoming sessions are sure to leave you spellbound:
AI: Ask the Experts
Speakers: Gary Lamach, AICPA & CIMA, Stephen Kalnoske, SANS Institute, Gavin Beddow, PeopleFluent & Chris Tompkins, Rustici Software
These days, it seems like you can't read an article without some mention of AI, but many people are wondering just what it can really do for them. Our panel of experts will share how they've used AI in their organization and what problems AI was able to solve.
Product Developments

Whew! 
Rustici: The Gathering
 day 1 was a success! We still can’t believe Tammy’s announcement that she’ll be chatting with Mike Rustici during the closing session Thursday. Talk about a 
gourd
 time! 🎃 And there’s still time for you to register and attend.
Day 2 of Rustici: The Gathering starts soon, and you won’t want to miss these featured sessions, no tricks, all treats:
Let's do this! Implementing xAPI in Your L&D Ecosystem
Speaker: Megan Torrance, TorranceLearning
Implementing xAPI requires a strategic mindset, a willingness to learn and adapt and a deep understanding of your organization's learning ecosystem along with the technical know-how.
What’s new with xAPI, and how we’ve improved xAPI performance in Engine
Speakers: George Vilches, Squarespace, and Ben Clark, Rustici Software
Interesting. Boring. Obscure. Listen in as George and Ben rant about -- or find no problem with -- the xAPI of yesteryear while sharing where the standard is at and how we've improved xAPI performance in Rustici Engine.
LRS or data analytics platform: What do I really need?
Speakers: Brian Miller and Andy Whitaker, Rustici Software
So you want to use xAPI and collect more data. That’s great! But did you know there are a variety of LRSs out there? Brian and Andy will discuss what an LRS does along with different LRS options, like a headless LRS vs. an LRS with a dashboard.

subject: See us at DevLearn, on-site or streaming live!
body:
Register now
Watch us live from DevLearn
Wednesday, Nov. 6 at 10:10 AM PST
Save your seat →
 
Our session will be available both live on-site and online for those who can't make it!
 
Deliver Training Outside the Box:
How LOMA Reaches Learners Where They Are
 
Think outside the box when it comes to your training distribution strategy! Learn how LOMA modernized their professional education approach to deliver industry-specific training to their association members. With 
Rustici Software’s Content Controller
, they now are able to seamlessly deliver valuable training content to more than 700 member organizations directly into their preferred learning platforms.
In addition, LOMA can now meet standards compatibility requirements and streamline the process of updating content through automatic versioning. You'll hear how their microlearning product, Industry Advantage, is designed to meet learners where they are. This allows LOMA to stay focused on delivering impactful education without the headache of manual updates while saving time and gaining visibility into training usage.
 
Register in advance to receive access to the livestream and the recording.
Attending DevLearn in-person? Come see us!
Stop by our booth #435 to chat with our team of experts
Wednesday, Nov. 6 from 10AM-6:30 PST and Thursday, Nov. 7 from 10AM-3:15PM PST
Come have a seat and discuss your learning technology challenges with us. We’ve got whiteboards ready and are excited to navigate you through your specific use case while providing suggestions on how tools can best work together. Let us know if you want to plan ahead and 
set up a time with us
 during the conference.
Morning Buzz on Adding AI to Your Tech Stack
Friday, Nov. 8 from 7:30AM-8:15AM PST
Get your caffeine fix with Chris Tompkins by joining in a casual discussion on the best practices for adding AI to your eLearning ecosystem while chatting with industry peers.
3 Pillars of a Successful Learning Analytics Strategy
Friday, Nov. 8 from 10AM-11AM PST
Chris Tompkins will equip you with the knowledge and tools necessary to develop a clear learning analytics strategy and influence positive outcomes through data-driven decision-making. You'll also leave with ideas, tips and inspiration based on real-life examples to progress your organization's approach to learning analytics.
Can't make it to Las Vegas?
We'd still love to talk about your specific eLearning standards questions, the tools in your ecosystem or answer any questions you may have.

subject: Preview our new add-on product at Rustici: The Gathering
body:
You’re invited to Rustici: The Gathering, a free, virtual conference designed specifically for our customers.
Rustici: The Gathering
Join us online Oct. 22 - 24, 2024
Register now →
 
Sifting through a sea of eLearning content can feel like you’re a Captain looking for a white whale. When you do finally find what you need, it may be too late, the course wasn’t practical to the learner personally or the learner needs to shift to new skills. Well, we have something new that we think will help you catch the right course on your lure.
Rustici Generator
 is our newest add-on product for Rustici Engine, which will be available Q1 2025. At its core, it is a content parser that uses AI modeling to understand your content. Now, this is the exciting part: It can handle eLearning content, PDFs, videos and more to build out metadata and transcriptions, and even help enhance search functionalities in your platforms.
You may have some questions on how does this tool work, is it right for me and my team, and can it generate weird AI pictures. Well at this 
Rustici: The Gathering
, we’re dedicating a session to the new product to preview what will be available when it launches.
We'll cover...
What is Rustici Generator?
Who can benefit from using it?
Where does AI fit into the application?
How do the features and integration work?
When can I start using it?
Our speakers Reed McLean, Lead Developer of Rustici Generator, and Ryan Pfeiffer, Senior Client Success Manager, will guide you through these questions to help start your imagination.
Check out the full agenda!
We have more AI-related sessions coming up, including an "Ask the Experts" panel and a deep dive into how the latest advancements in GenAI can be used with Content Controller. 
Attend The Gathering to find out! →

subject: The Link: Catch us at conferences, what’s this eLearning package and more
body:
The Link Newsletter
News from 
rusticisoftware.com
, 
scorm.com
, and 
xapi.com
September 2024, Issue 24
A gold medal summer
This summer flew by, and now it’s hard to believe that fall is days away and the kids are all back in school. The last few months have been a whirlwind of activity at Rustici, including our own office Summer Olympics, which featured our version of a decathlon relay, Wordle competitions and more. Some won gold, while my team took the ‘other gold.’
While we do love the fun games, we take awards for being a top place to work pretty seriously around here. This summer, we topped two lists, and kept our streak alive. We won the Nashville Business Journal’s 
Best Places to Work Award
 for the 15th consecutive year and a first for us in the “Large Company” category! But the awards weren’t just for our mantle. We medaled twice at the 
Brandon Hall Group HCM Awards
, winning gold with our Content Controller customer LOMA and securing a bronze for Alarm.com’s use of Content Controller.
We couldn’t be more proud of these accomplishments with our customers and continuing the streak of being a Best Place to Work. We’re taking this energy boost with us as we head into fall and buckle up for a jam packed few months ahead!
 
Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director
Upcoming events
Cooler weather means it’s time to see everyone at these fall conferences
We’ve already hit the road and kicked off our fall conferences. Chris and Tammy will be speaking and attending several events, including DevLearn in Las Vegas and ATD Core4 virtually. See where you can catch them in-person and online.
See where we're headed →
eLearning standards
What is this content package? There might not be a simple answer
We answer a lot of questions every day from the basic, “Where do I get started with SCORM?” to deeper technical questions. One we hear a lot is, “What is an eLearning package?” Follow Brian Miller down the rabbit hole to better understand what an eLearning package is and what types of packages you may run into.
Check out the blog →
Product news
Content Controller measures up to customers’ investment
With any learning technology investment, you want to make sure you receive the pay off you expect. In this blog, we continue the conversation from our measuring learning impact 
webinar with Watershed
 to show some of the returns our Content Controller customers have been seeing.
How to prove the value →
Case study
Centralizing content and compliance reporting with Penn Medicine
Penn Medicine, a global leader in healthcare and research, turned to Content Controller to enhance their learning ecosystem by simplifying the delivery of their training content across multiple LMSs. Once implemented, they improved cross departmental accessibility and efficiency while reducing the possibility of compliance issues.
Read their story →

 3rd Edition, a free, virtual conference designed specifically for our customers.
The theme this year is embracing and adapting to change. And with a variety of topics (including AI!), live Q&As and networking, this event is designed to give you the tools needed to adapt and embrace change in your learning ecosystem—as well as the flexibility to choose the topics most relevant to your organization’s challenges. We'll cover the technical side of things, led by developers for developers, to broader topics to help you make the most of our software in your application, brush up on your standards knowledge and create a stellar customer experience.
Here are a few standards sessions you're sure to enjoy:
Adaptive Learning with xAPI
Speaker: Anthony Altieri
Using xAPI, you can easily build your courses to self-tailor based on user behavior in a course, previous courses, or any other reportable metric. He'll also show some simple ways to build courses.
A Spectrum of Standards: SCORM Edition
Speakers: Joe Donnelly and Kyle Patmor, Rustici Software
After reviewing the range of colors on the eLearning standards spectrum, they'll dig into comparing the different shades of SCORM to help you find which one would be the best fit for your needs.
SCORM in a Docker Box? Operating Rustici Engine in a Containerized Environment
Speaker: Dónal Mac An Rí, Bluedrop ISM
This session explores encapsulating Rustici Engine in Docker containers. We’ll discuss the advantages and challenges of using Docker from local development to production deployment.
Check out the full agenda!
We’ve also tasked Joe Donnelly with solving the greatest conundrums in eLearning. Does he have what it takes to answer whatever questions Joshua Turner throws at him? 
Attend The Gathering to find out! →

subject: The Link: What is an eLearning standard, AI coming soon to Engine and more!
body:
The Link Newsletter
News from 
rusticisoftware.com
, 
scorm.com
, and 
xapi.com
June 2024, Issue 23
Coming soon: AI in our products
When it comes to AI, with a little imagination, you can find ways to put it to use for almost any application. It’s not a matter of if you’ll find a use case to leverage this capability, but how, where and when you’ll add it to your developer toolbox to help accelerate product development.
For us, we’ve been thoughtful about where and how AI makes sense in our world. We don’t want to just use AI for the sake of touting “AI is now in our products!” We often talk about using the right tool for the job to be done -- usually that’s in the context of which eLearning standard to use. But we’re a pedantic bunch of critical thinkers, so the challenge for us became -- 
where would it make sense to incorporate AI capabilities into our products
? We wanted to find the right problem set where it makes sense to apply AI tooling that will provide value to our customers before rolling out anything new. But the time is coming soon…
TL:DR - We found some good use cases, and you’ll see 
AI-driven capabilities
 coming by the end of the year.
Happy summer reading!
 
Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director
Product development
Introducing Rustici Generator, an AI-driven content processing service
We couldn’t wait to share the news about the upcoming Rustici Generator product. It will bring exciting capabilities to your applications, allowing you and your team to create unique personalized experiences.
Learn more →

subject: [Webinar] Which learning standard is best for your content? Find out!
body:
You don't often get email from webinar@rusticisoftware.com. 
Learn why this is important
Join us to learn more about which standard to use when and hear real examples.
                                                               
Upcoming webinar
 
Which learning standard is best for your content?
Find out Thursday, April 4th from 10-11AM CDT
Save your seat →
SCORM. xAPI. cmi5. LTI. AICC. Talk about alphabet soup! Just keeping up with these acronyms and standards can be difficult enough, but deciding which learning standard is best for your content and knowing which ones will work with the technologies in your ecosystem is even more challenging. But don’t worry, Joe Donnelly and Brian Miller are here to help you blend your content goals and choose a standard to meet them.
During this lively webinar, Joe and Brian will talk through the standards and give practical, real-world examples to help you better decide which standard best fits your needs.
Here are a few different examples of what you might be cooking up:
You want to add serious games into your future training plans and need to track with an LMS.
You have product education or traditional content, and you want to reach more customers and learners.
You need to track compliance training for employees at your organization.
Help! I’m not sure which standard is best or where to start!
If any of these sound familiar or if you're wondering which standard to use when, you won’t want to miss this webinar! 
Register now
 to join Joe and Brian on 
Thursday, April 4th at 10-11 AM CDT

The Link Newsletter

March 2024, Issue 22
Springing forward
Daylight savings might just be my favorite day of the year. I will gladly take those later sunsets, even if it does mean some dreary mornings, waking up before the sun for the next few weeks. For me the trade-off is worth it. Even though we lost an hour, I feel more rejuvenated as we jump into spring. That's a good thing because we have a pretty busy docket ahead of us with a 
full conference calendar
 and welcoming a few new faces to the team this month. We're even cooking up a new AI service you'll hear about more later this year.
I'm also rejuvenated by the way our teams have come together and embraced a 
hybrid working environment
. It's hard to believe that we've been at this now for four years. It's not always easy, but the benefits of letting people live and work where they want has really paid off for us.
 
Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director
Recent news
Learn a latte with us at upcoming conferences and webinars
If you’ve got travel plans to attend conferences, get your morning caffeine fix with us. subject: Let’s Stay Relevant in the Translation Industry by Taking the AI Bull by the Horns
body:
You don't often get email from sbammel@koreanconsulting.com. 
Learn why this is important
Recent discussions have reinforced something I’ve known for a while…
 
View this email in your browser
Steven S. Bammel, PhD
Korean-to-English Translator
Email: sbammel@koreanconsulting.com
Website: 
StevenBammel.com
Resume
 - 
"Consistently Good Work" Pledge
Hello,
Recent discussions have reinforced something I’ve known for a while… Many of the so-called leaders of the localization industry are barely paying attention to freelance translators or small LSPs. In fact, despite what they say about “human-in-the-loop” workflows, they expect we’ll be gone soon.
We can’t sit here and wait for the toolmakers, MT providers, and other big players to dictate the environment in which we work. The competitive pressures are too strong for that. To stay relevant over the long term, we’ve got to develop our own new-paradigm skill set.
Fortunately, Generative AI (GenAI; e.g.ChatGPT) gives us this opportunity! 
Right now, GenAI is a technology for small-scale magic. It is cheap, accessible, and powerful. With GenAI, we can raise both quality and efficiency from the bottom up, using tools and workflows that are more powerful than legacy NMT. 
This is why I keep emailing you about my 
GenAI for LSPs Workshop
. During this two-hour event (which is FREE, by the way), I cover the following points:
GenAI has superpowers.
GenAI will make you more productive.
Here’s how AI-savvy linguists are using GenAI right now.
As a project manager, you can use GenAI in your daily work, too.
Generative AI Iterative Translation (GAIT) is a next-generation workflow.
You can support your linguists during the GenAI transition.
Consider these four ideas to keep moving forward.
When you attend, I will share with you a temporary API key so that you can immediately experience the most powerful GenAI model currently available. You will also get a set of sophisticated prompts, a tool in which to use them (CotranslatorAI Free), some innovative ideas and perspectives, and inspiration to jump ahead.
I’ve given presentations about GenAI to thousands of translators over the past year and now I’m expanding my efforts. You might wonder why a freelance translator is inviting you to this 
GenAI forLSPs Workshop
. It’s because I’ve been obsessed with learning about and using GenAI in my language work and nobody is better placed than I am to give you insights into how to work with the technology and connect with your linguists in this area.
Several LSP clients have taken me up on my free workshop offer. If you can arrange at least four members of your team into a workshop, I’ll do a private event for you.
But I’ve also scheduled two “open” workshops for LSP clients who would like to attend individually or with just one or two team members. If you’re not ready for the private workshop, then I’d like to invite you to one of these open ones.
To register, simply click the workshop you wish to attend and then enter your information on the Zoom registration page that will pop up. I’ll then follow-up with you before the event with instructions to help you get ready.
Click here to register for Open Workshop #1: Tuesday, February 20 @ 1 PM Central European Time
Click here to register for Open Workshop #2: Friday, February 23 @ 4 PM US Eastern Standard Time
My workshop is nothing like other AI webinars out there; you will be glad you attended.
I hope to talk to you soon. 
Thanks,
Steven
What you can expect when you work with me:
Accurate, well-written, and well-formatted translations of your documents
On-time delivery every time, sometimes with overnight turnaround
Prompt and thorough communication before, during, and after your project
Single source for both English-to-Korean and Korean-to-English translation
I personally translate every Korean-to-English translation project myself.
My team and I work together on a best-practice, six-eye translation-edit-QA process for English-to-Korean translation jobs.
Consistently high quality from project to project by leveraging the latest technology and best-practice workflows
Transparent pricing structure that includes CAT and volume discounts
Workflow verifiability, US-based business registration, professional liability insurance, and my “Consistently Good Work” Pledge
Confidential handling of and respect for your intellectual property, including workflow options with additional security
Services I provide:
Korean>English translation
English>Korean translation
English>Korean trans-edit-QA
Korean>English revision
The main fields I work in:
Business management
Finance & accounting
Corporate/business legal
Intellectual property
Public sector
Medical & pharmaceutical

subject: The Link: Recapping 2023 with the standards and Rustici products
body:
You don't often get email from newsletter@rusticisoftware.com. 
Learn why this is important
The Link Newsletter
News from 
rusticisoftware.com
, 
scorm.com
, and 
xapi.com
December 2023, Issue 21
Reminiscing about 2023
2023 sure has flown by much more quickly than the song “The Twelve Days of Christmas.” Since it’s my 12th year at Rustici Software, and we love all things bird related, I thought it would be fun to remix the song with 
highlights from the year
. Alas, no swans a-swimming or French hens made the list, but some of our customers and our newest Rusticians did! As we’re wrapping up and reminiscing, we want to wish you all the best for a happy holiday season.
 
Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director
Recent news
We recently talked about cmi5 and met with our customers at I/ITSEC
This year marked the third consecutive year Brian Miller was accepted to speak at I/ITSEC! And Cameron Gray’s first time at the conference getting to meet his customers in person. Read more about why xAPI and cmi5 are playing such an important role in government training in Cameron’s recap.
View the blog →
eLearning standards
Don’t miss our 2023 eLearning standards recap and what’s next
Curious what happened in 2023 with eLearning standards and what might transpire over the next five years? Then you won’t want to miss IEEE LTSC voting members Chris Tompkins’ and Brian Miller’s upcoming webinar Jan. 23 at 10 AM CST. Can’t attend? Register and we’ll send you the recording after.
Sign up for the webinar →
Product news
New Content Controller features bring options to streamline workflow
Have you heard these before? “How can we engage with learners before they start the course? We need a way to send course notifications and receive data.” If so, the latest release of Content Controller 4.0 solves these problems and streamlines your content distribution.
See what's new →
Customer spotlight
See how Alarm.com is using Content Controller for their partner education
You are a big company with plans to grow, but this may not happen with so many platforms and learner types to accommodate. Rustici ventured to DevLearn 2023 with Alarm.com to show exactly how they overcame this hurdle and more, to take their organization to the next level quickly and efficiently using Content Controller.
Read their story →
Peek into our #pong-room Slack channel
Either a dumping ground or inner sanctum for the darkest corners of Rustici Software minds...depends who you ask. 😂

subject: See us at DevLearn via livestream or in-person!
body:
Register now and don't miss a thing!
We're going live from DevLearn
Wednesday, Oct. 25th at 10:10 AM PT
Save your seat →
 
Our session will be available both live on-site and online for those who can't make it!
 
Wake Up Your Training Strategy:
Alarm.com's Approach to Content Sharing
 
Rise and shine with a fresh approach to sharing your training content! Discover the simplicity in effortlessly delivering and managing content across various learning platforms where admins can seamlessly control access and automatically provide learners with updated versions, all from a centralized course library. You’ll hear how Alarm.com not only safeguards an owner’s property, but also how they protect their training content and gain visibility into how their courses are used across their extensive partner and reseller network with 
Rustici Software’s Content Controller
.
 
Register in advance to receive access to the livestream and the recording.
Attending DevLearn in-person? Come see us!
Stop by our booth #706 to chat with our team of experts
Wednesday, Oct. 25th from 10AM-6:30 PT and Thursday, Oct. 26th from 10AM-3PM PT
Come have a seat and discuss your learning technology challenges with us. We’ve got whiteboards ready and are excited to navigate you through your specific use case while providing suggestions on how tools can best work together. Let us know if you want to plan ahead and 
set up a time with us
 during the conference.
Planning for Learning Tech Procurement
Friday, Oct.27th from 7:30AM - 8:15AM PT
Have a cup of joe with Joe Donnelly in a casual Morning Buzz session to discuss the best practices for procuring learning technologies and enjoy chatting with industry peers.
Navigating Common Learning Standards: How to Stay Out of Trouble
Friday, Oct. 27th from 10AM - 11AM PT
Chris Tompkins and Joe will share their learning standards expertise and considerations for the delivery format, reporting requirements, and compatibility between systems. You will leave with a better understanding of the standards and how to choose the one that fits your needs.
Can't make it to Las Vegas?
We'd still love to talk about your specific eLearning standards questions, the tools in your ecosystem, or answer any questions you may have.
Let's chat →
 
Follow Rustici Software

subject: The Link: SCORM Cloud’s new Tester tier, Joe’s lost completion quest, where you’ll find us and Andy’s LRS tips
body:
The Link Newsletter
News from 
rusticisoftware.com
, 
scorm.com
, and 
xapi.com
September 2023, Issue 20
Together or apart, it’s important to stay connected while hybrid
What a whirlwind of a summer! We hosted our 2nd annual customer conference, Rustici: The Gathering, with over 300 customers joining us virtually for 3 days of sessions featuring 15 guest speakers and 30 Rusticians. From our own take on Hot Ones with Joe to hearing our Content Controller customers discuss scaling their content distribution strategies, and from industry experts dropping their xAPI knowledge to 
how we keep the culture while hybrid
 - we covered a lot of ground.
Once we caught our breath, we said farewell to summer with our all-company meetings, that we now call Quails (long story), and a good old fashioned field day. Fun fact: Andy Whitaker’s secret talent is quail egg/spoon racing. And now? We’re continuing to keep the hybrid balance of staying connected virtually and hanging out in-person.
 
Tammy Rutherford, Managing Director
Recent news
Will we see you at an upcoming conference? We hope so!
Many students went back to school in the last month, and we’re ready to head back out to conferences! We’re excited to see so many customers in person at TechLearn, DevLearn and I/ITSEC this fall. Be sure to schedule time to chat and attend our speaking sessions at each event.
See where we're at →
eLearning standards
Questing to limit lost SCORM completions and save the day
Joe Donnelly and Kyle Patmor know a thing or two about SCORM lost completions. After all, they answer those questions every day. Hear their top tips for limiting this common SCORM predicament and leave the dungeon with the completion treasure.
View the recording →
Product news
You asked and now we have a new SCORM Cloud Tester plan
SCORM Cloud is an integral part of testing courses for customers and non-customers alike. As content requirements have changed, so have testing needs. That’s why we added a new Tester plan tier specifically for all the users who are testing very frequently.
Sign up for Tester →
Ask us anything
Do I need a headless LRS and one with native reporting features?
There are several options out there, so how do you know if what you really need is a player, an integrated LRS or a full-fledged reporting tool with an analytics dashboard? Andy shares his advice and considerations for choosing a Learning Record Store (LRS) to fit your needs.
Learn more →

subject: Re: SCORM Cloud check-in/ renewal
body:
Hi Kelly & Team, 
We're approaching the end of your SCORM Cloud Bulk purchase term, which expires 
September 30, 2023
. Language & Culture Worldwide has used roughly 3,600 registrations out of the 100,000 pre-purchase last Oct 1, 2022. Considering the low usage, I wanted to reach out and learn more and see if there is anything I can do to help. 
Please let me know if you would like to schedule a call to discuss further. Also, do you plan on renewing your Bulk purchase, or are you planning on switching to a 
monthly plan
.  Our SCORM Cloud pricing increased this year for the first time in 
13 years
 for monthly plans and Bulk plans. We can offer a renewal SCORM Cloud Bulk purchase of 
100,000 registrations
 for 
$13,000
 to be used over 12 months or when consumed, whichever comes first. We appreciate your business and are happy to help. 
I've attached the Bulk purchase agreement renewal for you to go ahead with the renewal. When is the best time to schedule a quick call? I am based in Nashville, TN, which is in Central time.  
Best, 
Philip Fallin
Sales Manager
Rustici Software
615.236.6376  
rusticisoftware.com
  |  
scorm.com
  |  
experienceapi.com

Hi Randy – please implement accordingly so that the video resumes exactly where it was paused if in mid-watch, and then share the SCORM – is there no way to make the CCs to ALWAYS appear automatically?
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray
 
From:
 Randy Pringle <
r.pringle@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, September 8, 2023 10:20 AM
To:
 Sayak Ray <
sray@diligent.com
>
Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
The early completion has been adjusted.
 
The captions are set to automatically display. But if a user would stop on a video slide and then resume later there is a “CC” button in the player frame. The logic tells the caption to start in transition from the previous slide to the video slide so if that is interrupted or stopped just click the cc button to toggle.
 
As far as bookmarking the software is set up so you would have to click the video again to restart if you left before it completes.
 
There are variables that can be custom built so it would resume exactly where it was paused if in mid-watch.
If that is something you want to implement let me know.
 
Also I can send a new SCORM with the completion corrected. 
I’ll wait to hear from you on the video pause logic.
 
Thanks
 
Randy Pringle
Multimedia Developer
LCW

We have the following note from the client regarding the English SCORM test results – 
 
While testing the English version of the SCORM file, the course is being marked as complete prior to the checking the certification box at the end. Could you please check?
 
FYI, they are currently checking the SPLA preview.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for UCF for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya

Subject:

The early completion has been adjusted.
 
The captions are set to automatically display. But if a user would stop on a video slide and then resume later there is a “CC” button in the player frame. The logic tells the caption to start in transition from the previous slide to the video slide so if that is interrupted or stopped just click the cc button to toggle.
 
As far as bookmarking the software is set up so you would have to click the video again to restart if you left before it completes.
 
There are variables that can be custom built so it would resume exactly where it was paused if in mid-watch.
If that is something you want to implement let me know.
 
Also I can send a new SCORM with the completion corrected. 
I’ll wait to hear from you on the video pause logic.
 
Thanks
 
Randy Pringle
Multimedia Developer

Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for UCF for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya
 
 
Maya Benoit

From:

r.pringle@lcwmail.com

Sent:
 Friday, September 8, 2023 10:20 AM
To:
 Sayak Ray <
sray@diligent.com
>
Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
The early completion has been adjusted.
 
The captions are set to automatically display. But if a user would stop on a video slide and then resume later there is a “CC” button in the player frame. The logic tells the caption to start in transition from the previous slide to the video slide so if that is interrupted or stopped just click the cc button to toggle.
 
As far as bookmarking the software is set up so you would have to click the video again to restart if you left before it completes.
 
There are variables that can be custom built so it would resume exactly where it was paused if in mid-watch.
If that is something you want to implement let me know.
 
Also I can send a new SCORM with the completion corrected. 
I’ll wait to hear from you on the video pause logic.
 
Thanks
 
Randy Pringle
Multimedia Developer

Hi Team,
 
We have the following note from the client regarding the English SCORM test results – 
 
While testing the English version of the SCORM file, the course is being marked as complete prior to the checking the certification box at the end. As long as the user makes it to that screen, the file tells our Workday system that the user completed the course, even without check the certification box. Will you please have this fixed. 
 
Also, when leaving the course, the file is bookmarking where the user left off, but the video does not automatically start, and the user has to click twice on the video screen for it to begin playing. The captions also turn off on the bookmarked video and there is no option to turn them back on during the video playback. However, if the user navigates to a previous section of the training and back to the video where they left off, the caption options return.
 
Could you please check?
 
FYI, they are currently checking the SPLA preview.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for UCF for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya
 
 
Maya Benoit

 Friday, September 8, 2023 2:30 PM
To:
 Randy Pringle <r.pringle@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
Hi Randy – please implement accordingly so that the video resumes exactly where it was paused if in mid-watch, and then share the SCORM – is there no way to make the CCs to ALWAYS appear automatically?
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray
 
From:
 Randy Pringle <
r.pringle@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, September 8, 2023 10:20 AM
To:
 Sayak Ray <
sray@diligent.com
>
Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
The early completion has been adjusted.
 
The captions are set to automatically display. But if a user would stop on a video slide and then resume later there is a “CC” button in the player frame. The logic tells the caption to start in transition from the previous slide to the video slide so if that is interrupted or stopped just click the cc button to toggle.
 
As far as bookmarking the software is set up so you would have to click the video again to restart if you left before it completes.
 
There are variables that can be custom built so it would resume exactly where it was paused if in mid-watch.
If that is something you want to implement let me know.
 
Also I can send a new SCORM with the completion corrected. 
I’ll wait to hear from you on the video pause logic.
 
Thanks
 
Randy Pringle
Multimedia Developer

Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for UCF for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya

subject: RE: UCF - for client review
body:
The early completion has been adjusted.
 
The captions are set to automatically display. But if a user would stop on a video slide and then resume later there is a “CC” button in the player frame. The logic tells the caption to start in transition from the previous slide to the video slide so if that is interrupted or stopped just click the cc button to toggle.
 
As far as bookmarking the software is set up so you would have to click the video again to restart if you left before it completes.
 
There are variables that can be custom built so it would resume exactly where it was paused if in mid-watch.
If that is something you want to implement let me know.
 
Also I can send a new SCORM with the completion corrected. 
I’ll wait to hear from you on the video pause logic.
 
Thanks
 
Randy Pringle

Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for UCF for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya
 
 
Maya Benoit
Translation Coordinator
LCW

Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for UCF for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya
 
 
Maya Benoit
Translation Coordinator
LCW

Subject:
 RE: UCF - for client review
 
 
Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for UCF for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya
 
 
Maya Benoit
Translation Coordinator
LCW

Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for UCF for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya

Subject:

Importance:
 High
 
Hi Team,
 
We have a request from our client 
Pentec Health
 to make some changes to their previous Code of Conduct course – the updated version would serve as their 2023 course. 
I have attached all details.
 
We’ll need to publish a preview link with the changes made and then a SCORM upon approval.
 
Since I will be away the whole of next week, in case the preview link becomes ready before my return on August 14
th
, please make sure to notify 
@Naomi Cavanagh
 so that she can share the preview link with the client. I shall take over communications upon my return.
 
Please use 
WO_PEN_CoC_08042023
 as the work order number.
 
Please note that this job needs to be fully delivered (final SCORM delivery) on or before 18
th
 August. Therefore, please plan accordingly.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

The person on your team can look at the attached file and see if the characters appear in the file, then we can figure out if perhaps the font via the Articulate cloud could be defaulting to something else?
 
Could they check this file and see?  Thanks! That way we can tell Sayak to pay for getting them changed. If it is on the way they appear in Articulate, we may have to change the subtitle font from the program. 
 
Cheers,
Dustin

Hi Maya,
 
We're now seeing this message:
 
 
Here are some instructions you could follow:
Please change the privacy settings by following the screenshot below to allow the video to be embedded in 
amara.org
The first setting, "Private", disables embedding.
If you set your video to “Public”, "Password" or "Hide on Vimeo", and for the embed, Specific Domains "
amara.org
", it'll play on Amara.
 
Other things to keep in mind - if applicable:
If your videos are in a Showcase that is password protected - the Editor can't enter that password to get to the URLs.
If you could remove them from the Showcase and make each video individually password protected, then Amara should be able to access the URL and require the password to load in the editor. Hopefully they can be moved back into a showcase after they've been captioned.
 
We look forward to hearing from you, Maya. Thank you!

Hi Team,
 
We had been having multiple back and forths with the client and they have now approved the English preview – they however have a few comments, mostly functional and not content related, which, after being addressed, should make the preview okay to move to translations.
 
The videos shared by the client have auto enabled CCs – there is no need for toggling CCs on/off with an additional button – please remove the CC buttons from all the speaker videos shared by the client
The Compliance email on the "Instructions" page has a link that is clickable, but does not redirect to anywhere. Please fix the same. If it cannot be fixed, the url should remain the same, underlined, but the live link should be removed (similar to last year)
 
Apart from these two fixes, we are good to proceed to SPLA translations.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

 RE: Cordis Update

 High
 
Hi Randy,
 
Please see urgent note from the client below – can this exact scenario be tested and checked?
 
We launched the course today and we’re having an issue with the English version on Quiz 5 where if I answer wrong it get’s stuck on three dots blinking..  (trying to verify other languages also)
 
 
The bottom banner seems to look a bit odd but not sure that has anything to do with it. 
 
 
Can you please help resolve ASAP
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

k.salek@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Cordis Update
 
 
Hi Sayak
 
I was able to upload the English SCORM package successfully in our SCORM Cloud environment (see below). 
 
https://app.cloud.scorm.com/sc/InvitationConfirmEmail?publicInvitationId=4a351da4-c88a-4d6e-8e72-d1e28cee24a2
 
This environment mirrors any LMS system being used, while also allowing us to test any errors of functionality issues. Today I uploaded the exact file I shared and received no errors. It would be my guess that the file is trying to overwrite a previously used file and the LMS system is not liking the replacement file…hoping they are not unzipping or changing the name of the file. 
 
Perhaps the Cordis team or whomever is uploading the zip might want to try these two solutions:
 
Try creating a new entry on the system to test the English file using a new form. If it works, it might mean that the files are not named correctly when exchanging the SCORM files. 
 
Suggest that the LMS team (the individual who is uploading the file) contacts myself and Kelly in a video/share screen meeting as a way to see how the error shows up upon uploading. 
 
Thoughts? I have cc’d Kelly as well to assist.
 
Randy Pringle
Multimedia Developer
LCW 
Tampa, FL
Direct: +1 (727) 420-1071

subject: RE: Cordis Update
body:
Hi Sayak
 
I was able to upload the English SCORM package successfully in our SCORM Cloud environment (see below). 
 
https://app.cloud.scorm.com/sc/InvitationConfirmEmail?publicInvitationId=4a351da4-c88a-4d6e-8e72-d1e28cee24a2
 
This environment mirrors any LMS system being used, while also allowing us to test any errors of functionality issues. Today I uploaded the exact file I shared and received no errors. It would be my guess that the file is trying to overwrite a previously used file and the LMS system is not liking the replacement file…hoping they are not unzipping or changing the name of the file. 
 
Perhaps the Cordis team or whomever is uploading the zip might want to try these two solutions:
 
Try creating a new entry on the system to test the English file using a new form. If it works, it might mean that the files are not named correctly when exchanging the SCORM files. 
 
Suggest that the LMS team (the individual who is uploading the file) contacts myself and Kelly in a video/share screen meeting as a way to see how the error shows up upon uploading. 
 
Thoughts? I have cc’d Kelly as well to assist.
 
Randy Pringle
Multimedia Developer
LCW 
Tampa, FL
Direct: +1 (727) 420-1071

Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for Wolters Kluwer for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya

Hi Randy,
 
Thank you for volunteering to review the new LCW website before it officially launches! 
 
I've schedule a block on your calendar for you to review the website. During this time, please use the instructions below to complete the review.
 
Your pages to focus on (but please review/share feedback on any page):
 
Downloadable Resources, Blog, Podcast 
 
Instructions:
 
NOTE: THIS IS NOT A MEETING; IT IS A HOLD
 
Go to this link to reach the staging site: 
https://lcw1.wpengine.com/
Use [username: demo | password: staging] to enter the staging site
Use the top navigation bar to review the website looking for notes on copy, user experience, and aesthetics
Review the pages you've been asked to focus on especially close
Record any notes you have in the tracker (attached) - please use a separate row for each piece of feedback, even if it is on the same page as a previous note 
At the end of your review block, save your notes tracker and send it back to Jake
 
A few notes:
The contents of the blog, podcast, events, careers, and downloadable resources pages may still need to be properly formatted and some of the functionality is still being tested
The site has not been fully optimized for mobile yet - please use your desktop to review
We're going to read and consider every note submitted to us, but at the end of the day we may have to reconcile conflicting notes
 
Ashton and I will be compiling the notes from the many volunteers we received and will apply consolidated feedback all at once.
 
Thank you so much for your time! We're excited for you to see the site!
 
Jake

Hi Sayak,
 
Please find attached the translations for Wolters Kluwer for their internal review. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!
 
Best,
Maya

Hi Randy,
 
I’m reaching out to you about the new LCW website. We’re on track for a June 30 launch date and are looking for volunteers to review the final site’s copy before launch. 
 
If you were to be a website reviewer, you would:
Receive a one-hour calendar block within the next week to review the website on your own using staging site login information
Be asked to provide full website feedback, but be given 2-5 specific pages to focus on
Record your feedback in a tracker
Send your feedback back to Jake at the end of your one-hour review block
 
Please reply to this email by end of day tomorrow June 16
th
 if you’d be willing to provide your feedback and can commit to this timeline!
 
Thank you for your help!
 
Jake

Hi Randy,
 
Italian QA is also completed with comments online.
 
There may be one indicating change needed to narration/caption.
The translator sent me below as extra comment to explain:
 
the translation contains something that makes nonsense of an entire section: the English text says, more or less "we are asked to pay a fee to a government official" (and a "fee" could be fishy, of course"), this has been translated as to say "we are asked to pay a tax to a government official" -- now a tax ("tassa" in this incorrect translation) is something that sounds legitimate and that a Government official may be required to charge), so the meaning of the entire section goes out of the window.
 
I believe for Cordis we did not do the caption/narration on the video, correct?
 
So, is this then something we need to share with Sayak to see if they want us to update this?
And is this something we can update or would it need to be done on their end?
 
Thanks,
Maya

Subject:
 Cordis Cod of Conduct 2023
 
Hi Team,
 
We are starting a new project for 
Cordis
 for their 2023 Code of Conduct course. WO is attached.
 
A few highlights – 
This will be English + Translations
Their choice of design template is 
“Code of Conduct_design template #2_circle” – 
they would like to customize this with their own logo, images and colours
All videos required for this project are available in the library for download. Closed captions should be present in your repository
The client would be sending their CEO video along with subtitles (English as well as translated), later in the project lifecycle
They will be sharing the images of their choice in the next few days – for now they have shared only 2 – I will share them as soon as I receive them
 
I have shared the following items as shown below – 
Content/customization template
WO
Visual assets (Logo and Imageds)
 
 
The first step would be to create the English preview within the customized design template.
 
Please let me know of any questions. We shall discuss ETAs in our next status call.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Hi Franco,
 
I will be sending out the project for Diligent via Trados Team today.
Here just a few details on the project. These will also be available in the Notes section of the project.
 
Project details:
Attached is the word analysis files for your reference
Translation task will be sent out today, so you should receive a notification from Trados Team. 
Deadline: 2
nd
 June – this includes translation and proofreading
EN source link for reference: will be provided soon
Process Trados Team: I send out only a ‘translation task’, however this includes the proofreading as well. Once you have downloaded the files for translation, you can communicate directly on your end via email with your proofreader as usual. The translation task will simply need to be completed with your final version.

Subject:
 Question KO - 2023132 - Diligent - Teradata CoC 2023
 
Hi Randy,
 
For Korean, the linguist indicated that there were some segmentation issues in the files.
He needed to merge some translated segments that are split in the English.
 
This has let to some segments remaining in English in the exported file:
 
So basically, all the Korean translation is gathered in the first segment. The two others are already contained into the Korean on top.
 
What is best to do here?
Should we simply delete the English in the last column? Will Articulate allow import like that or would it cause any issues?
Should the translator split up the Korean segment? This will be random of course, because for example there is no word in Korean for ‘The’.
 
It may also be good to see how we can avoid this type of segmentation in the future as this is bound to cause issues during translation.
 
Thanks,
Maya

Hi Maya - We've completed this job and uploaded it to Trados. 
 
Note that the segmenting was horrible in sections, but the files aren't allowing us to combine segments in either the desktop software, or online. Therefore, you will see a lot of empty segments. It's very easy to fix though, as we've bunched all of the translation into the first segment when multiple segments should have been combined. For example:
 
 
As you can see, segments 24-26 should be combined and we've placed the entire translation of these three segments in segment 24. So all you need to do is combined segments 24-26 and it will be correct. The same logic applies throughout all three documents.
 
I've attached the intermediate files here for your reference.
 
Thanks,
Steven

Subject:
 Question KO - 2023132 - Diligent - Teradata CoC 2023
 
Hi Randy,
 
For Korean, the linguist indicated that there were some segmentation issues in the files.
He needed to merge some translated segments that are split in the English.
 
This has let to some segments remaining in English in the exported file:
 
So basically, all the Korean translation is gathered in the first segment. The two others are already contained into the Korean on top.
 
What is best to do here?
Should we simply delete the English in the last column? Will Articulate allow import like that or would it cause any issues?
Should the translator split up the Korean segment? This will be random of course, because for example there is no word in Korean for ‘The’.
 
It may also be good to see how we can avoid this type of segmentation in the future as this is bound to cause issues during translation.
 
Thanks,
Maya
 
Maya Benoit

Hi Maya - OK, I have marked the other two files as completed.
 
As for the English in the target, this is because of the awful segmenting and the software automatically copying source to target. That's not the way I uploaded 
 
 
As an additional formatting task, do you want me to go back through and just arbitrarily reallocate the Korean across the cells? There's no way to make the Korean match the English though. For example, Korean doesn't even include the word "the", so the first segment can't represent anything meaningful in Korean.
 
The video files are even worse.
 
We had a good workflow before, but bringing things over to Trados Teams doesn't seem ideal.
 
Steven

Hi Maya - We've completed this job and uploaded it to Trados. 
 
Note that the segmenting was horrible in sections, but the files aren't allowing us to combine segments in either the desktop software, or online. Therefore, you will see a lot of empty segments. It's very easy to fix though, as we've bunched all of the translation into the first segment when multiple segments should have been combined. For example:
 
 
As you can see, segments 24-26 should be combined and we've placed the entire translation of these three segments in segment 24. So all you need to do is combined segments 24-26 and it will be correct. The same logic applies throughout all three documents.
 
I've attached the intermediate files here for your reference.
 
Thanks,
Steven

Hello Kevin,
I updated the Word documents accordingly, per attached. We have always used Word documents for the internal review process/step. It’s easier to implement the requested changes before the final language modules are built. Please let me know if there is anything else. I enclosed the internal review instructions again for your convenience. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Thank you!
 
 
María

Hello Sayak,
 
I attempted to review the translated files but they don’t appear to be setup the same way English Review was (link I click on and I press Play and it automates the training). Please find attached the translations for MacLean Fogg, for internal review. Please note our translators noted that the client is using two different terms for Helpline:
ComplianceLine Helpline and EthicsPoint Helpline. Do they use two different helplines? We would like to make sure this is not an error.
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Kindly confirm safe receipt. Thank you!

Subject:
 RE: MacLean Fogg - Code of Conduct 2024
 
 
Hello Kevin,
I updated the Word documents accordingly, per attached. We have always used Word documents for the internal review process/step. It’s easier to implement the requested changes before the final language modules are built. Please let me know if there is anything else. I enclosed the internal review instructions again for your convenience. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Thank you!
 
 
María

subject: FW: 2023 UCF Code of Conduct Training Module
body:
From:
 Carla Markx <Carla.Markx@ucf.edu> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, May 31, 2023 11:53 AM
To:
 Jim Calabrese <jcalabrese@diligent.com>; Sayak Ray <sray@diligent.com>; Randy Pringle <r.pringle@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Christina Serra <Christina.Serra@ucf.edu>
Subject:
 2023 UCF Code of Conduct Training Module
 
Good morning,
 
I hope this email finds you well. Christina and I have already begun preparing for this year’s launch of our annual Code of Conduct training scheduled for September 2023. Tarra Premisler used to kick off the development process of the annual code module customizations with us in late March/April, to include development of a timeline and meeting bi-weekly. Being close to June, we’re hoping that a September launch is still doable this year. Do you happen to have availability in the next week to discuss this year’s training customizations? Christina and I are available during the following days/times:
 
Thursday, June 1: 3pm – 5pm
Monday, June 5: 12pm – 5pm
Tuesday, June 6: 12pm – 5pm
Wednesday, June 7: 10am – 2:00pm; 3:30pm – 5pm
Thursday, June 8: 11am – 1pm; 2pm – 4pm
Monday, June 12: 10am – 3pm
 
Please let me know what works best with your schedule, and what forms you need from us so we can send those to you in advance.
 
Thank you. We look forward to working with you and your team this year.
 
 
 
 
Carla M. Markx, CCEP, FCRM
Manager, Compliance and Ethics
 
University of Central Florida
University Compliance and Ethics
4365 Andromeda Loop N, MH 396
Orlando, FL 32816-0001
Office: 407-823-4323
Fax: 407-823-6265
http://compliance.ucf.edu
http://ucfintegrityline.com
 
PLEASE NOTE: Florida has a very broad public records law. Most written communication to or from University employees regarding University business are public records available to the public upon request. Your e-mail communications, including your e-mail address may be subject to public disclosure.

Subject:
 RE: MacLean Fogg - Code of Conduct 2024
 
 
Hello Kevin,
I updated the Word documents accordingly, per attached. We have always used Word documents for the internal review process/step. It’s easier to implement the requested changes before the final language modules are built. Please let me know if there is anything else. I enclosed the internal review instructions again for your convenience. 
 
Internal Review Instructions:
 
The reviewer must use track changes (no comments, colors, highlights, etc.)
The reviewer needs to be specific with changes – no comments such as “wrong translation”, “too literal”, etc. – we need to know exactly what they’d like to convey.
Text between percentages should stay in ENG, for example, 
%Results.PassPercent%%. This is Storyline code – it will display a number, a date, etc.
Make sure font, font size, colors, etc. are maintained throughout the document. 
Important:
 Storyline does NOT export the content for translation in order:
5.1. Do NOT add rows with new content, it will corrupt the file to import final translations
5.2. Text might be repeated several times, this is not an error – do NOT delete repeated content. 
LCW translators will review changes and finalize the Word doc before placing translations into Storyline.
ALL change requests will be applied to and assumed as final.  
 
Thank you!
 
 
María
