subject: RE: MacLean Fogg - Code of Conduct 2024
body:
Kevin,
 
The instructions on this one were misinterpreted. They used the same course as last year while only changing the topics/videos.
The rest pretty much stayed the same. I do see it in their template now and thanks to the translators it was caught and addressed beforehand.
 
Ethics Line is what they had called it in 2022. Renaming your company reporting line to me is a major change. Surprised they didn’t mention to y’all and also that the online preview was approved.
 
 
Randy Pringle

LCW

Hi All,
 
To the best of my recollection.
 
After their 2021 code was delivered and possibly deployed on their end (I’m not sure if they rolled it out).
The company’s name changed from Euler Hermes to Allianz Trade. They had reached out to see if they could have the name changed in the Code of Conduct as well as any linked documents of theirs.
 
Erin I believe mentioned to them this would involve customization costs since the 2021 was approved by them, delivered and the name change happened well after the fact.
 
So is this a new 2023 CoC and we’ll be using the new name OR is this a request to update the 2021 material?
The latter seems odd - so clue me in please.

subject: RE: URGENT!! - Allianz Trade - Euler Hermes - Code of Conduct 2023
body:
Hi All,
 
To the best of my recollection.
 
After their 2021 code was delivered and possibly deployed on their end (I’m not sure if they rolled it out).
The company’s name changed from Euler Hermes to Allianz Trade. They had reached out to see if they could have the name changed in the Code of Conduct as well as any linked documents of theirs.
 
Erin I believe mentioned to them this would involve customization costs since the 2021 was approved by them, delivered and the name change happened well after the fact.
 
So is this a new 2023 CoC and we’ll be using the new name OR is this a request to update the 2021 material?
The latter seems odd - so clue me in please.
 
 
Randy Pringle
Multimedia Developer
LCW 
Tampa, FL
Direct: +1 (727) 420-1071
 
   
 
From:
 Sayak Ray <sray@diligent.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, May 24, 2023 5:43 AM
To:
 Dustin Puehler <d.puehler@lcwmail.com>; Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>; Randy Pringle <r.pringle@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Kevin McCoy <kmccoy@diligent.com>; Kunal Agrawal <kagrawal@diligent.com>; Jim Calabrese <jcalabrese@diligent.com>
Subject:
 URGENT!! - Allianz Trade - Euler Hermes - Code of Conduct 2023
Importance:
 High
 
Hi Team,
 
We were contacted by 
Allianz Trade (Euler Hermes)
 to pick up their code of conduct project from where it was left off.
They had suggested a few updates in October 2022 and it went blank after that. We don’t have any information whether those comments/suggestions were worked on.
 
In the attached email thread Jim had asked Randy the same question but I cannot find a reply to this email in my inbox – apologies if I missed it. The attached thread also contains the gist of last comments shared by the client.
 
All in all, could you please let me know the status of the Allianz Trade / Euler Hermes code of conduct project? Where we stand? What the last comments worked on were etc.? We intend to start working on this project ASAP.
 
Since I will be away the whole of next week, please respond as soon as you can. Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

please find the translated bilingual file attached for review.
 
Two items need clarification:
 
The name of the helpline: EthicsPoint Helpline or ComplianceLine Helpline? The German Business Code of Conduct only uses ComplianceLine Helpline.
 
And the correct translation for “Review”. Since I was not provided the link to the source module I could not verify what content is on the slide. I would strongly prefer to NOT use the term “Review” as a title for a slide because it never really reflects the content.
 
Kind regards,
Uta

Subject:
 Cordis Cod of Conduct 2023
 
Hi Team,
 
We are starting a new project for 
Cordis
 for their 2023 Code of Conduct course. WO is attached.
 
A few highlights – 
This will be English + Translations
Their choice of design template is 
“Code of Conduct_design template #2_circle” – 
they would like to customize this with their own logo, images and colours
All videos required for this project are available in the library for download. Closed captions should be present in your repository
The client would be sending their CEO video along with subtitles (English as well as translated), later in the project lifecycle
They will be sharing the images of their choice in the next few days – for now they have shared only 2 – I will share them as soon as I receive them
 
I have shared the following items as shown below – 
Content/customization template
WO
Visual assets (Logo and Imageds)
 
 
The first step would be to create the English preview within the customized design template.
 
Please let me know of any questions. We shall discuss ETAs in our next status call.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Hi Randy – I think lets make all responses like the one in the attached screenshot.
 
That is, a correct response would read – “the correct answer is A” or “the correct answer is B” followed by the explanation. 
For incorrect responses we can say – “A is not the right answer” or “B is not the right answer” – no explanation needed.
 
Was I able to explain properly?
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

subject: RE: ADT CoC 2023
body:
Hi Sayak
Update - These KTC mini modules are converted.
 
 
Randy Pringle
Multimedia Developer
LCW 
Tampa, FL
Direct: +1 (727) 420-1071
 
   
 
From:
 Sayak Ray <sray@diligent.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, March 30, 2023 9:59 AM
To:
 Dustin Puehler <d.puehler@lcwmail.com>; Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>; Randy Pringle <r.pringle@lcwmail.com>; Maya Benoit <M.Benoit@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Kevin McCoy <kmccoy@diligent.com>; Kunal Agrawal <kagrawal@diligent.com>; Jim Calabrese <jcalabrese@diligent.com>
Subject:
 ADT CoC 2023
Importance:
 High
 
Hi Team,
 
ADT would be starting their 2023 Code of Conduct project soon.
 
They are still working on their content for this year and would want to use the same design template. I shall share more details later.
 
They would like to use a few 
Know the Code mini module videos
 for their 2023 code of conduct. Can you please confirm if the following topics are converted to Storyline, and if not whether these can be converted with ease? Would you want any raw materials from us?
 
https://www.compliancewavelibrary.com/articles/20160127
https://www.compliancewavelibrary.com/articles/20131008
https://www.compliancewavelibrary.com/articles/20080716_9
 
They would not want the certification page at the end – but they would want the rest of the module. The certification page would come at the end of the CoC course just like a standard code of conduct project.
 
Please let me know. Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Hi Kevin,
 
Thanks for the email.  Apologies for the delay, but I’ve been struggling here, since we keep having issues with these refresh videos not granting completion for our users on the iPad, and this one we are discussing also caused the same issue last year.  I’m hoping maybe we can avoid this issue from happening when we roll out this video again.  I’ve answered your questions in 
red 
below.  
 
In addition, I would like to share LAST YEAR’S branded version of the video, so you can see how it was put together.  Our issue with these videos has been at the end when the user clicks the blue circle w/arrow to “exit”.  The video exits but, no completion is granted on the iPad (it works fine on the laptop).  I am still waiting for our training portal vendor to answer the questions you sent over.  See my note in 
red 
below.
 
In addition, this same titled video that is the interactive module (with the assessment question) DOES seem to work on the iPad, so it makes me wonder if it has something to do with the page with the restart/click to exit arrows.  Just another thought.
 
Questions
:
Please confirm that it is the video and not the interactive module (with assessment questions)?  
Correct.  Video brief only and NOT the interactive module (i.e., NO assessment questions.)
If video, is the delivery format .MP4?  
I’m actually not sure.  I have a zip file that I would like to send you if you can provide me a way to get it to you.
Will we use your Logo as already provided to Sayak for Code? 
Yes, but you can also view last year’s video I would like to share.
If there are more than one logo please clarify which you require? 
N/A
Will you be providing a Closing Slide in PowerPoint format? 
We did not provide a closing slide.  Our close has been the “click to restart or click to exit that your team created”. That is the slide that has been causing us issues, and maybe we need something else?
 
*NOTE: I have our NEW leadership video for this year that will be used in front of the video.  I also need a way to get it to you. As a reminder, we are NOT using the video from last year.

Here are the replies from the linguist.
Let me know if you want me to send it back one more time for a final check after changes have been made.
 
 
Issue 1
 
At 1:43 on the video on slide 4/26, the following caption is shown:
 
 
When it leaves the screen, the following text should appear starting at 1:45.
 
마지막으로
 
본
 
규범은
 
당사자가
 
목격한
 
것으로
 
보이는
 
After that, the following caption (which currently starts at 1:45) can start at around 1:48.
 
 
 
Issue 2
 
On Slide 8/26, the following is the text for the missing caption at 2:24:
 
지역을
 
분할하거나
 
고객
 
불매운동에
 
가담하는
 
It is the first half of the sentence that continues with the caption beginning at 2:28, so there should not be much space between the two.
 
You might as well have me check these when updated.

 Randy Pringle <r.pringle@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: KOR Victaulic
 
Here are the replies from the linguist.
Let me know if you want me to send it back one more time for a final check after changes have been made.
 
 
Issue 1
 
At 1:43 on the video on slide 4/26, the following caption is shown:
 
 
When it leaves the screen, the following text should appear starting at 1:45.
 
마지막으로
 
본
 
규범은
 
당사자가
 
목격한
 
것으로
 
보이는
 
After that, the following caption (which currently starts at 1:45) can start at around 1:48.
 
 
 
Issue 2
 
On Slide 8/26, the following is the text for the missing caption at 2:24:
 
지역을
 
분할하거나
 
고객
 
불매운동에
 
가담하는
 
It is the first half of the sentence that continues with the caption beginning at 2:28, so there should not be much space between the two.
 
You might as well have me check these when updated.

 Randy Pringle <
r.pringle@lcwmail.com
>

subject: Interim LCW Accountants - Book+Street
body:
Good afternoon folks,
 
We’re currently using an accounting service called Book+Street to assist with the day-to-day staff accountant responsibilities while we search for a full-time staff accountant. 
 
The two interim accountants are:
Michelle Murcia 
michelle@bookandstreet.com
Pamela Coulter 
pamela@bookandstreet.com
 
They’re currently having some issues accessing the 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 address. If you receive an email from the two folks above, they are legit, not a scam. 
 
If you’re trying to get ahold of accounting, you can still use the accounting@ email. We have folks managing that inbox. 
 
Thanks,
 
Briza Cardenas
